title: Why has there never been a major motion movie about Hannibal Barca and his real story as the original freedom fighter would be just as good as Alexander the Great? - Quora

response.answer_text: Personally…I don’t think Hannibal Barca could really be considered the “original freedom fighter” as he was just as much in favor of Carthaginian imperialism as the Romans were for their Roman imperialism. Both nations sought to rule over other lands. Carthage ruled over much of Spain long before the Romans got there…and Roman rule over that peninsula generally came about by defeating the Carthaginians and replacing Punic rule with their own…although it was not until the reign of Augustus Caesar that the Roman rule over Spain was finally consolidated. The only “freedom” Hannibal sought was freedom from rule by the Romans…but he had no objection to his own city, Carthage, ruling over others. Hardly a “freedom fighter”! Considering how much of what is called “Western Civilization” is ultimately derived from Roman precedents and how different it would have been had the Carthaginians been victorious…it is probably fortuitous that the war between Rome and Carthage ended the way it did…with a Carthaginian defeat, otherwise our world would be very different…and not really better at all.

Well it definitely is a great story full of drama and action. However, if Hannibal is your hero the story has an anti-climactic ending. Hannibal’s father had fought the Romans in the previous war which sets up his life’s ambition to destroy Rome. It’s not so much a story of liberation as it is about two rival powers fighting for influence. Hannibal did not have the full backing of his government which adds to this idea of a rebel, and a great element of political conflict. Ultimately his ‘hero’s quest’ fails, after a sting of victories, arriving at his goal and just not having the force or power to see it through. This war was waged over many years and in different styles. Ultimately it ends with Hannibal retreating and being defeated at home. His city and it’s empire crumbles. The war was fought in Spain, Italy, North Africa and the Mediterranean Islands over years and years. I think it’s a difficult story to tell and, again, the hero ends up defeated, exiled to Greece with his home destroyed. If this story gets told, it also needs to include Scipio Africanus who defeats him, avenging his father, uncle and all the Romans lost during the war. Probably and easier story to tell. History is written by the winners. Had Hannibal won, he would be the hero of the story. As it stands, his story is more like a Shakespearean tragedy where his zeal is his hamartia which gains him victories but ultimately leads to his defeat, over extended with no way to win. Would definitely watch this movie/series though.
